wikipedia_page.main: Geoffrey Lawrence, 3rd Baron Trevethin, 1st Baron Oaksey,  (2 December 1880 – 28 August 1971) was the main British judge during the Nuremberg trials after World War II, and President of the Judicial group.

response: * August 28 – Geoffrey Lawrence, 1st Baron Oaksey, British Judge during the Nuremberg trials after World War II (b. 1880)
*Geoffrey Lawrence, 1st Baron Oaksey (1880–1971) (succeeded as Baron Trevethin in 1959)
* Geoffrey Lawrence, 1st Baron Oaksey (1880–1971), British judge during the Nuremberg trials

link_mentions.page: Geoffrey Lawrence, 3rd Baron Trevethin and 1st Baron Oaksey

response: He was the son of the noted jurist Geoffrey Lawrence, 1st Baron Oaksey, and his wife Marjorie, daughter of Commander Charles Robinson, RN. He preferred to be called Oaksey, although Trevethin is the longer-established title. In his broadcasting career, he was initially known as John Lawrence before adopting the name John Oaksey when he succeeded to the baronies on the death of his father in 1971.  The Oaksey family seat is the parish of Oaksey in the extreme north of Wiltshire, between Malmesbury and Cirencester.
